text.__SUMMARY__:
Tillandsia dyeriana is a species of plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is endemic to Ecuador.  Its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical mangrove forests. It is threatened by habitat loss.
Recently this plant was reclassified as Racinaea dyeriana.
text.Sources: Manzanares, J.M. & Pitman, N. (2003). "Tillandsia dyeriana". The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. IUCN. 2003: e.T43335A10797757. doi:10.2305/IUCN.UK.2003.RLTS.T43335A10797757.en. Retrieved 22 December 2017.
